turns.content: This is Agent Thomas Mitchell from the IRS speaking. We've been trying to reach Grandpa Walter regarding a serious tax violation. Can you confirm this is his line?

I am indeed Walter, but I don't recall having any issues with the IRS or receiving calls about it. Could you tell me more about what's going on? My wife might want to be here for this too. Would that be alright?

This isn't something we'd typically recommend bringing a third party into, sir. The matter is quite urgent and sensitive. We've been tracking an unpaid tax bill of $4850 stemming from 2019 which has now compounded with penalties and interest. If this hasn't been resolved by the end of today, legal authorities will be notified to make an immediate arrest at your residence. Can you address this right away?

Oh my, that sounds very serious indeed. Can I verify your information first before we proceed? My wife is downstairs; she might have more details on our taxes from back then. Is there a number where you're located or another way to confirm who I'm speaking with? I feel more comfortable if we can check this out formally.

I completely understand your concerns, Grandpa Walter. For security reasons, I cannot provide an office number here. However, for your peace of mind, verify the amount due and confirm you are indeed Mr. Walter from. To resolve this swiftly and avoid any legal troubles, we need to act now. You can purchase a $4850 worth of Vanilla Visa gift cards at any store and provide me with the card numbers here so I can process your payment immediately. We have strict guidelines against disclosure beyond that. Can you do this promptly, sir?

Wait, wait, hold on just a moment there. You're asking for gift card numbers? That doesn't sound right at all. The IRS wouldn't ask me to pay like this, would they? I think maybe we need to talk this through some more or perhaps let me call back after speaking with my lawyer and checking our records properly. Something isn't adding up here.

Grandpa Walter, time is of the essence here. The IRS does not request payment by gift cards under normal circumstances, but these are not ordinary circumstances. If you don't settle this immediately, we will be forced to issue an arrest warrant for failing to comply with tax obligations. Please act now and avoid further complications. Don't let legal issues escalate needlessly. Can you follow through with the resolution steps I provided?

I understand your urgency, but I really think there must be a mistake here. This all feels very strange. We'll sort this out another way, perhaps after checking with some trusted advisors. Thank you for your patience and understanding. I need to hang up now and take care of this properly with my wife's help and maybe the advice of someone at our local tax office or an attorney. I appreciate your concern though.
